comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: B-59:  Thanks for uncovering the full name for Dubois.  We'll add it to the description next time we update.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: King George was in France reviewing troops from Oct. 21-Nov. ,1 1915; It was during his visit to the front in 1915 that, on Oct. 28, "he met with a somewhat serious accident, which laid him up for some weeks, through his horse rearing and falling backwards on him, being startled by the sudden cheering of a regiment whom he was inspecting." www.1911encyclopedia.org/George_V This looks to be the same occasion as in an Agence Meurisse photo shown at Bibliotheque Nationale de France's Gallica site, with the following caption: "La revue du roi d'Angleterre sur le front français : de droite à gauche : le général Joffre,le roi George V, le général Dubois, le Prince de Galle " [Review of the King of England on the French front: from right to left: General Joffre, King George V, General Dubois, the Prince of Wales] This Bain photo also looks like it is from the same occasion:
